problem.markdown:
>>Which cross-sectional shape is the most efficient? I.e., if all other parameters are kept constant, which shape uses the least amount of material?<< ( ) A solid section (x) A hollow section ( ) An I-beam
[explanation] In this simulation the hollow section is the most efficient. By moving the area of the cross-section away from the center you get a higher moment of inertia thus more resistance to bending for less total area. It would be possible to design an i-beam that was as efficient or even more efficient but for this simulation the i-beam is less efficient. [explanation]
